content.raw:
When loading Motive for MoCap calibration, there are several issues:

* Motive fails to find the OptiTrack Trio on first pass, and therefore cannot run because it cannot locate the license file. The USB cable has to be unplugged and plugged back in to the same exact USB port. Sometimes this doesn't work and the virtual Windows machine needs to be rebooted.
* Motive cannot load any pre-saved project (*.ttp) files without failing to respond. Response failure happens when loading the haptix_osrf.ttp file from the file browser or from trying to open the file within Motive. The only workaround is to make a new haptix_osrf.ttp file from scratch.

On top of the aforementioned software bugs, when Motive does start working, the calibration is not consistent. Calibrations yield inconsistent MoCap even when following the same exact calibration steps. Sometimes HAPTIX will run with good MoCap right away, other times the need for re-calibration is obvious due to the scene being off-monitor or head/hand motions not being properly tracked.

When loading Motive for MoCap calibration, there are several issues:

  • Motive fails to find the OptiTrack Trio on first pass, and therefore cannot run because it cannot locate the license file. The USB cable has to be unplugged and plugged back in to the same exact USB port. Sometimes this doesn't work and the virtual Windows machine needs to be rebooted.
  • Motive cannot load any pre-saved project (*.ttp) files without failing to respond. Response failure happens when loading the haptix_osrf.ttp file from the file browser or from trying to open the file within Motive. The only workaround is to make a new haptix_osrf.ttp file from scratch.

On top of the aforementioned software bugs, when Motive does start working, the calibration is not consistent. Calibrations yield inconsistent MoCap even when following the same exact calibration steps. Sometimes HAPTIX will run with good MoCap right away, other times the need for re-calibration is obvious due to the scene being off-monitor or head/hand motions not being properly tracked.
